ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Clouding vs. Undead
ygData.msgSnippet: Level 1 decaying skeletons do not follow the same rules either. They don t attack when I go through newbie areas.
ygData.messageBody:
Level 1 decaying skeletons do not follow the same rules either.
They don't attack when I go through newbie areas.

>-----Original Message-----
>From: Lonnie Lewis [mailto:llewis@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2000 8:07 AM
>To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] Clouding vs. Undead
>
>
>From: Lonnie Lewis <llewis@...>
>
>Actually, that's not true. Hags were white to me, and /conned indifferent,
>and didn't attack. Same with werebats, skeletal monks, etc. It's
>just that
>some (barbed bones, a skeleton) see through, no matter the difference. I
>still don't know why level 5 a skeletons attack me anymore.
>
>Bien
>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: Kevin L. Crawford [SMTP:Lyrnia@...]
>> Sent: Tuesday, March 21, 2000 11:04 AM
>> To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> Subject: [eqbards] Clouding vs. Undead
>>
>> From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
>>
>> Everyone that I have ever seen purport that Clouding works vs. undead
>> seems to have 1 major misconception:
>>
>> All the undead in unrest except Barbed bones (and higher) are under level
>> 20, which means they have green coward code affecting them. You
>could, at
>> level 30, walk around in unrest pretty much unperturbed by ANY of the
>> undead simply because they won't attack you because you're so far above
>> them in level.
>>
>> Just because an undead critter doesn't attack doesn't mean you're
>> invisible to them. Try using clouding then CONNING the undead. They
>> still con as 'ready to attack'. Which means they can see you. They just
>> won't agg because you are higher level than them.
>>
>> Lyrnia the amused.
>>
>>
>> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>>
>>
